intro: Ctenitis melanochlamys, commonly known as the black-chalmed sea holly, is a species of green alga belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its dark green color and the presence of a distinct, serrated margin on its thallus. This species typically grows in marine environments, particularly on rocky substrates in shallow coastal waters. The thallus is usually flat and ribbon-like, with a firm and leathery texture. It plays an important role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
